verbose_text: Chen et al. [XREF_BIBR] co-cultured PRP and human nucleus pulposus cells and found that PRP significantly up-regulated Sox9 and mRNA expression of type II collagen and proteoglycan, promoted mucopolysaccharide aggregation, and participated in the engineering of nucleus pulposus differentiation into cartilage via formation of collagen scaffolds, probably mediated by the Smad signaling pathway.
